explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the application of deep neural networks in financial literature, specifically for bank credit ratings and risk assessment, which falls under the umbrella of machine learning.
explanations.semi-supervised learning: The paper mentions that their learning system uses semi-supervised learning to handle labels of varying sparsity, integrating credit ratings and SRISK for a comprehensive assessment.
explanations.neural network: The proposed model, HFTCRNet, is a type of neural network designed for interbank credit rating and risk assessment.
explanations.deep learning: The paper focuses on developing advanced neural networks (deep learning models) to model intricate temporal dynamics and interconnected relationships in the banking system.
explanations.representation learning: The hierarchical fusion transformer (HFT) module and other components of HFTCRNet are designed to capture and integrate various types of information, which involves learning representations of the data.
explanations.attention mechanism: The paper includes modules like the attentive risk contagion transformer (ARCT) which likely utilize attention mechanisms to focus on relevant parts of the data for risk assessment.
